intro: Sarratia berlandieri var. denticulata, commonly known as the denticulate sarratia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native habitat.
